contents:
18 My favorite memory from Jan 6 posted 2 hours ago by 2021is1776-2 3 comments award share report block During this violent and totally 10x worse than 9/11 insurrection my wife and I had time to stop at a food truck parked right across from the ultra violent event and order a nice pretzel and soda (who knew by today’s standards they would be reasonably priced) then go sit on the water fountain and eat them.
3 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save Around the Web 1 Simple Hack to Save on Your Electric Bill (Try Tonight) GadgetCyno NadlersNads 1 points 43 minutes ago When the text from bowser hit i realized i hadnt eaten in 2 days and nothing was going to be open all night so i walk jogged the few miles back to my hotel, cancelled that night and drove across the bridge to stay at a nicer hotel in VA. Checked in and had to charge the phone a bit so i turned on the news to watch cbs lie about everything.. made a call to a bar 3 blocks down to make sure they were open and bartender said yep, open till 11 or 12 depending on traffic. By time i got down to the lobby a text rang out to warn everyone now VA was locked down ... the only thing open was a corner store where i had to settle for luncheables, jerky and coors light permalink award report block reply OhinIdaho 1 points 1 hour ago And purchase Trump swag from vendors. Best day ever. permalink award report block reply HowDoYouTurnThisOn 1 points 2 hours ago Comment removed by community filter. permalink award report block reply
NadlersNads 1 points 43 minutes ago When the text from bowser hit i realized i hadnt eaten in 2 days and nothing was going to be open all night so i walk jogged the few miles back to my hotel, cancelled that night and drove across the bridge to stay at a nicer hotel in VA. Checked in and had to charge the phone a bit so i turned on the news to watch cbs lie about everything.. made a call to a bar 3 blocks down to make sure they were open and bartender said yep, open till 11 or 12 depending on traffic. By time i got down to the lobby a text rang out to warn everyone now VA was locked down ... the only thing open was a corner store where i had to settle for luncheables, jerky and coors light permalink award report block reply
